item.title: Report E-2024100704
item.description:
Report E-2024100704

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-31T09:22:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: EL PASO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 15, 2024, four (4) 5-gallon pails of UN3266 were damaged and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. The damaged pails and all impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100702
item.description:
Report E-2024100702

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-31T09:22:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-14
  • City: WALLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 14, 2024, four (4) one-gallon jugs of paint were damaged and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior and contents of the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Coastal Environmental Solutions (COENS) to remediate the impacted site. Crews collected the impacted shrink wrap, and impacted cardboard boxes the product was contained in, for disposal. COENS personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas, and worked them in with hand tools. Crews restacked the undamaged freight for normal transport. All paint (UN1263) impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum, two (2) 30-gallon drums, and one (1) 15-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024100658
item.description:
Report E-2024100658

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-30T09:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-11
  • City: SANGER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 11, 2024, one (1) 2.5-gallon jug of UN1824 was damaged in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to cardboard boxes. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized neutralizing agent to remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged jug were containerized in two (2) 30-gallon drums for waste disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024100141
item.description:
Report I-2024100141

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-24T09:29:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-13
  • City: Houston
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Shortly after takeoff the crew was alerted by the customer that their laptop was overheating and smoking. . Customer stated that before leaving BZE their luggage containing the laptop was dropped in the ocean. . TCB used for laptop emitting smoke. The laptop remained in the bag, and the device was no longer emitting smoke. There was no emergency declared and the flight continued to its destination.

item.title: Report X-2024101296
item.description:
Report X-2024101296

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-24T09:29:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: LUBBOCK
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/8/2024, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 6089803 at the ramp facility in Lubbock, repoting a dry ice spill. The shipment consisted of frozen food packed on dry ice on a fiberboard box. The outer package collasped from the condensation produced by the dry ice, resulting in the spillage of the dry ice. The shipper was contacted to retrieve the pacakage.
